12-25.title: James Webb Space Telescope Launch (2021)
12-25.description: The most powerful space telescope ever built was launched from French Guiana, marking a new era in astronomical observation and our understanding of the universe.

07-20.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing (1969)
07-20.description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon, with Armstrong famously saying 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.'

timeline.title: Sputnik 1 Launch
timeline.description: The Soviet Union successfully launched the first artificial satellite, marking the beginning of the Space Age and the space race.

timeline.title: First Human in Space
timeline.description: Yuri Gagarin became the first human to journey into outer space, completing one orbit around Earth in 108 minutes aboard Vostok 1.

timeline.title: First Woman in Space
timeline.description: Valentina Tereshkova became the first woman to travel to space, spending almost three days in orbit aboard Vostok 6.

timeline.title: First Spacewalk
timeline.description: Alexei Leonov performed the first spacewalk (EVA), spending 12 minutes outside his Voskhod 2 spacecraft.

timeline.title: Luna 9 Moon Landing
timeline.description: The first successful soft landing on the Moon by an unmanned spacecraft, transmitting the first images from the lunar surface.

timeline.title: Apollo 8 Lunar Orbit
timeline.description: First crewed mission to leave Earth orbit and travel to the Moon, capturing the iconic 'Earthrise' photograph.

timeline.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
timeline.description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon, fulfilling President Kennedy's goal of landing on the Moon before the end of the 1960s.

timeline.title: First Space Station
timeline.description: Soviet Union launched Salyut 1, the world's first space station, beginning the era of long-duration spaceflight.

timeline.title: Apollo-Soyuz Test Project
timeline.description: The first joint US-Soviet space mission, symbolizing d√©tente between the two superpowers during the Cold War.

timeline.title: Voyager 1 & 2 Launch
timeline.description: Twin spacecraft launched to explore the outer solar system, with Voyager 1 now being the farthest human-made object from Earth.

timeline.title: Space Shuttle Era Begins
timeline.description: Columbia launched on STS-1, inaugurating the Space Shuttle program and reusable spacecraft era.

timeline.title: Mir Space Station
timeline.description: Soviet Union launched the Mir space station, which operated for 15 years and hosted international crews.

timeline.title: Hubble Space Telescope
timeline.description: The Hubble Space Telescope was deployed, revolutionizing our understanding of the universe and providing stunning images of distant galaxies.

timeline.title: First Exoplanet Discovery
timeline.description: 51 Pegasi b became the first confirmed exoplanet orbiting a main-sequence star, opening the field of exoplanet research.

timeline.title: ISS Construction Begins
timeline.description: The first module of the International Space Station (Zarya) was launched, beginning construction of humanity's largest space structure.

timeline.title: Mars Exploration Rovers
timeline.description: Spirit and Opportunity rovers landed on Mars, beginning an era of robotic exploration that far exceeded mission expectations.

timeline.title: SpaceX Falcon 1 Success
timeline.description: SpaceX achieved the first privately-funded liquid-propellant rocket to reach orbit, revolutionizing commercial spaceflight.

timeline.title: Curiosity Mars Landing
timeline.description: NASA's Curiosity rover successfully landed on Mars using the revolutionary sky crane landing system.

timeline.title: New Horizons at Pluto
timeline.description: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft became the first to visit Pluto, revealing a complex and dynamic world.

timeline.title: First Gravitational Waves
timeline.description: LIGO detected gravitational waves for the first time, confirming Einstein's prediction and opening a new era of astronomy.

timeline.title: First Black Hole Image
timeline.description: The Event Horizon Telescope captured the first image of a black hole's event horizon in galaxy M87.

timeline.title: Crew Dragon Demo-2
timeline.description: SpaceX became the first commercial company to send astronauts to the ISS, ending US dependence on Russian Soyuz.

timeline.title: Perseverance Mars Landing
timeline.description: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully landed on Mars, beginning its mission to search for signs of ancient microbial life and collect rock samples.

timeline.title: James Webb Launch
timeline.description: The most powerful space telescope ever built launched, designed to observe the earliest galaxies and study exoplanet atmospheres.

timeline.title: DART Asteroid Impact
timeline.description: NASA's DART mission successfully impacted asteroid Dimorphos, demonstrating planetary defense capabilities.

timeline.title: Artemis I Success
timeline.description: NASA's uncrewed Artemis I mission successfully completed a lunar flyby, paving the way for human return to the Moon.
